gurmukhi: <> siqgur pRswid ]
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace if divine preceptor

gurmukhi: 1 gurU is`KwN dI krnI
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace if divine preceptor

gurmukhi: bilhwrI iqnHwN gurisKwN jwie ijnw gur drsnu ifTw
transliteration: Balihaaree Tinhaan Gurasikhaan Jaai Jinaa Gur Darasanu Ditdaa.
translation: I am sacrifice unto those Gursikhs who go to have the glimpse of the Guru.

gurmukhi: bilhwrI iqnHwN guris`KwN pYrI pY gur sBw bihTw
transliteration: Balihaaree Tinhaan Gurasikhaan Pairee Pai Gur Sabhaa Bahitdaa.
translation: I am sacrifice unto those Gursikhs who touching the feet sit in the assembly of the Guru.

gurmukhi: bilhwrI iqnHwN guris`KwN gurmiq bol boldy imTw
transliteration: Balihaaree Tinhaan Gurasikhaan Guramati Bol Boladay Mitdaa.
translation: I am sacrifice unto those Gursikhs who speak sweet.

gurmukhi: bilhwrI iqnHwN guris`KwN puqR imqR gurBweI ieTw
transliteration: Balihaaree Tinhaan Gurasikhaan Poutr Mitr Gur Bhaaee Itdaa.
translation: I am sacrifice unto those Gursikhs who prefer their fellow disciples to their sons and friends.

gurmukhi: bilhwrI iqnHwN guris`KwN gur syvw jwxin AiBirTw
transliteration: Balihaaree Tinhaan Gurasikhaan Gur Sayvaa Jaanani Abhiritdaa.
translation: I am sacrifice unto those Gursikhs who love the service to the Guru.

gurmukhi: bilhwrI iqnHwN guris`KwN Awip qry qwryin sirTw
transliteration: Balihaaree Tinhaan Gurasikhaan Aapi Taray Taarayni Saritdaa.
translation: I am sacrifice unto those Gursikhs who get across and make other creatures also swim across.

gurmukhi: gurisK imilAw pwp pixTw ]1]
transliteration: Gurasikh Miliaa Paap Panitdaa ?1?
translation: Meeting such Gursikhs, all the sins are removed.

gurmukhi: 2 gur is`KwN dw in`qnym
translation: Daily routine of Gursikhs

gurmukhi: kurbwxI iqnHwN gurisKwN ipCl rwqI auiT bhMdy
transliteration: Kurabaanee Tinhaan Gurasikhaan Pichhal Raatee Outdi Bahanday.
translation: I am sacrifice unto those Gursikhs who get up in the last quarter of night.

gurmukhi: kurbwxI iqnHwN gurisKwN AMmiRq vylY sir nwvMdy
transliteration: Kurabaanee Tinhaan Gurasikhaan Anmritu Vaylai Sari Naavanday.
translation: I am sacrifice unto those Gursikhs who getting up in the ambrosial hours, and bathe in the holy tank.

gurmukhi: kurbwxI iqnHwN gurisKwN hoie iek min gur jwpu jpMdy
transliteration: Kurabaanee Tinhaan Gurasikhaan Hoi Ik Mani Gur Jaapu Japanday.
translation: I am sacrifice unto those Gursikhs who remember the Lord with single devotion.

gurmukhi: kurbwxI iqnHwN gurisKwN swDsMgiq cil jwie juVMdy
transliteration: Kurabaanee Tinhaan Gurasikhaan Saadhasangati Chali Jaai Jurhanday.
translation: I am sacrifice unto those Gursikhs also who go to the holy congregation and sit there.

gurmukhi: kurbwxI iqnHwN gurisKwN gurbwxI iniq gwie suxMdy
transliteration: Kurabaanee Tinhaan Gurasikhaan Gurabaanee Niti Gaai Sounanday.
translation: I am sacrifice unto those Gursikhs who sing and listen to Gurbani daily.

gurmukhi: kurbwxI iqnHwN gurisKwN mn mylI kir myil imlMdy
transliteration: Kurabaanee Tinhaan Gurasikhaan Mani Maylee Kari Mayli Miladay.
translation: I am sacrifice unto those Gursikhs who meet others whole-heartedly.

gurmukhi: kurbwxI iqnHwN gurisKwN Bwie Bgiq gurpurb krMdy
transliteration: Kurabaanee Tinhaan Gurasikhaan Bhaai Bhagati Gurapurab Karanday.
translation: I am sacrifice unto those Gursikhs who celebrate Guru’s anniversaries with full devotion.

gurmukhi: gur syvw Plu suPlu PlMdy ]2]
transliteration: Gur Sayvaa Phalu Suphal Phaladay ?2?
translation: Such Sikhs become blest by the service of the Guru and progress further successfully.

gurmukhi: 3 gur is`K dw ihrdw
translation: The heart of the Sikh of the Guru

gurmukhi: hau iqsu ivthu vwirAw hodY qwix ju hoie inqwxw
transliteration: Hau Tis Vitahu Vaariaa Hodai Taani Ju Hoi Nitaanaa.
translation: I am sacrifice unto him who being mighty considers himself powerless.

gurmukhi: hau iqsu ivthu vwirAw hodY mwix ju rhY inmwxw
transliteration: Hau Tis Vitahu Vaariaa Hodai Maani Ju Rahai Nimaanaa.
translation: I am sacrifice unto him who being grand considers himself humble.

gurmukhi: hau iqsu ivthu vwirAw Coif isAwxp hoie ieAwxw
transliteration: Hau Tis Vitahu Vaariaa Chhodi Siaanap Hoi Iaanaa.
translation: I am sacrifice unto him who repudiating all cleverness becomes childlike

gurmukhi: hau iqsu ivthu vwirAw KsmY dw BwvY ijsu Bwxw
transliteration: Hau Tisu Vitahu Vaariaa Khasamai Daa Bhaavai Jisu Bhaanaa.
translation: I am sacrifice unto him who loves the will of the Master.

gurmukhi: hau iqsu ivthu vwirAw gurmuK mwrgu dyiK luBwxw
transliteration: Hau Tisu Vitahu Vaariaa Guramoukhi Maaragu Daykhi Loubhaanaa.
translation: I am sacrifice unto him who becoming gurmukh wishes to follow the way of the Guru.

gurmukhi: hau iqsu ivthu vwirAw clx jwix jugiq imhmwxw
transliteration: Hau Tisu Vitahu Vaariaa Chalanu Jaani Jougati Mihamaanaa.
translation: I am sacrifice unto him who considers himself a guest in this world and keeps himself ready to depart from here.

gurmukhi: dIn dunI drgh prvwxw ]3]
transliteration: Deen Dounee Daragah Paravaanaa ?3?
translation: Such a person is acceptable here and in the hereafter.

gurmukhi: 4 gur is`K Aprs hY
translation: Gurmukh is a detached one

gurmukhi: hau iqsu Goil GumwieAw gurmiq irdY grIbI AwvY
transliteration: Hau Tisu Gholi Ghoumaaiaa Guramati Ridai Gareebee Aavai.
translation: I love him deeply who cultivates humility through Gurmat, the wisdom of Guru.

gurmukhi: hau iqsu Goil GumwieAw pr nwrI dy nyiV n jwvY
transliteration: Hau Tisu Gholi Ghoumaaiaa Par Naaree Day Nayrhi N Jaavai.
translation: I love him deeply who does not go near another’s wife.

gurmukhi: hau iqsu Goil GumwieAw prdrbY no hQu n lwvY
transliteration: Hau Tisu Gholi Ghoumaaiaa Par Darabai No Hadu N Laavai.
translation: I love him deeply who touches not the other’s wealth.

gurmukhi: hau iqsu Goil GumwieAw pr inMdw suix Awpu htwvY
transliteration: Hau Tisu Gholi Ghoumaaiaa Par Nidaa Souni Aapu Hataavai.
translation: I love him deeply who becoming indifferent to the backbiting of others detatches himself.

gurmukhi: hau iqsu Goil GumwieAw siqgur dw aupdys kmwvY
transliteration: Hau Tisu Gholi Ghoumaaiaa Satigur Daa Oupadaysu Kamaavai.
translation: I love him deeply who listening to the teaching of the true Guru practices it in actual life.

gurmukhi: hau iqsu Goil GumwieAw QoVw svY QoVw hI KwvY
transliteration: Hau Tisu Gholi Ghoumaaiaa Dorhaa Savai Dorhay Hee Khaavai.
translation: I love him deeply who sleeps little and eats little.

gurmukhi: gurmuiK soeI shij smwvY ]4]
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soee Sahaji Samaavai ?4?
translation: Such a gurmukh absorbs himself in the equipoise.

gurmukhi: 5 gur is`K gRXwnI hY
translation: Gursikh is a knowledgeable person

gurmukhi: hau iqs dY cauKMnIAY gur prmysru eyko jwxY
transliteration: Hau Tis Dai Chaoukhanneeai Gur Paramaysaru Ayko Jaanai.
translation: I am ready to be cut into four pieces for him who accepts Guru and God as one.

gurmukhi: hau iqs dY cauKMnIAY dUjw Bwau n AMdir AwxY
transliteration: Hau Tis Dai Chaoukhanneeai Doojaa Bhaau N Andari Aanai.
translation: I am ready to be cut into four pieces for him who does not allow the sense of duality to enter in him.

gurmukhi: hau iqs dY cauKMnIAY Aaugux kIqy gux prvwxY
transliteration: Hau Tis Dai Chaoukhanneeai Aougounu Keetay Goun Paravaanai.
translation: I am ready to be cut into four pieces for him who understands the evil done to him as good one.

gurmukhi: hau iqs dY cauKMnIAY mMdw iksY n AwiK vKwxY
transliteration: Hau Tis Dai Chaoukhanneeai Mandaa Kisai N Aakhi Vakhaanai.
translation: I am ready to be cut into four pieces for him who never speaks ill of anyone.

gurmukhi: hau iqs dY cauKMnIAY Awpu Tgwey lokw BwxY
transliteration: Hau Tis Dai Chaoukhanneeai Aapu Tdagaaay Lokaa Bhaanai.
translation: I am ready to be cut into four pieces for him who is ready to suffer loss for the sake of others.

gurmukhi: hau iqs dY cauKMnIAY praupkwr kry rMg mwxY
transliteration: Hau Tis Dai Chaoukhanneeai Paraoupakaar Karai Rang Maanai.
translation: I am ready to be cut into four pieces for him who enjoys doing altruistic activities.

gurmukhi: laubwlI drgwh ivic mwxu inmwxw mwxu inmwxY
transliteration: Laoubaalee Daragahi Vichi Maanu Nimaanaa Maanu Nimaanai.
translation: I am ready to be cut into four pieces for him who enjoys doing altruistic activities.

gurmukhi: gur pUrw gur sbid is\\\\wxY ]5]
transliteration: Gur Pooraa Gur Sabadu Siaanai ?5?
translation: Such a humble person understanding the Word of Guru, himself becomes the perfect Guru.

gurmukhi: 6 is`K dI inSkwm AvsQw
translation: The selfless state of the Sikh

gurmukhi: hau sdky iqnHwN gurisKwN siqgur no imil Awpu gvwieAw
transliteration: Hau Sadakay Tinhaan Gurasikhaan Satigur No Mili Aapu Gavaaiaa.
translation: May I be a sacrifice unto those Gursikhs who, meeting the true Guru have lost their ego.

gurmukhi: hau sdky iqnHwN gurisKwN krn audwsI AMdir mwieAw
transliteration: Hau Sadakay Tinhaan Gurasikhaan Karani Udaasee Andari Maaiaa.
translation: May I be a sacrifice unto those Gursikhs who, while living amidst maya, remain indifferent to it.

gurmukhi: hau sdky iqnHwN gurisKwN gurimq gurcrxI icqu lwieAw
transliteration: Hau Sadakay Tinhaan Gurasikhaan Guramati Gur Charanee Chitu Laaiaa.
translation: May I be a sacrifice unto those Gursikhs who, in accordance with Gurmat concentrate their mind on the feet of the Guru.

gurmukhi: hau sdky iqnHwN gurisKwN gur isK dy gur isK imlwieAw
transliteration: Hau Sadakay Tinhaan Gurasikhaan Gur Sikh Day Gurasikh Milaaiaa.
translation: May I be a sacrifice unto those Gursikhs who, imparting the teachings of the Guru make another disciple meet the Guru.

gurmukhi: hau sdky iqnHwN gurisKwN bwhir jwNdw vrij rhwieAw
transliteration: Hau Sadakay Tinhaan Gurasikhaan Baahir Jaandaa Varaji Rahaaiaa.
translation: May I be a sacrifice unto those Gursikhs who, have resisted and bounded the outgoing mind.

gurmukhi: hau sdky iqnHwN gurisKwN Awsw ivic inrwsu vlwieAw
transliteration: Hau Sadakay Tinhaan Gurasikhaan Aasaa Vichi Niraasu Valaaiaa.
translation: May I be a sacrifice unto those Gursikhs who, while living among hopes and desires.

gurmukhi: siqgur dw aupdys idVHHwieAw ]6]
transliteration: Satigur Daa Oupadays Dirhhaaiaa ?6?
translation: Remain indifferent to them and learn steadfastly the teaching of the true Guru.

gurmukhi: 7 bHmw dI krqUq
translation: Mischief of Brahma

gurmukhi: bHmw vfw AKwiedw nwiB kvl dI nwil smwxw
transliteration: Brahamaa Vadaa Akhaaidaa Naabhi Kaval Dee Naali Samaanaa.
translation: Calling himself great, Brahma entered into the naval lotus (Of Visnu to know its end).

gurmukhi: Awvw gvxu Anyk jug EVk ivic hoAw hYrwxw
transliteration: Aavaa Gavanu Anayk Jag Aorhak Vichi Hoaa Hairaanaa.
translation: For many ages he wandered in the cycle of transmigration and ultimately become dumbfounded.

gurmukhi: EVku kIqosu Awpxw Awp gxwieAY Brim Bulwxw
transliteration: Aorhaku Keetosu Aapanaa Aap Ganaaiai Bharami Bhulaanaa.
translation: He left no stone unturned but remained misguided in his own so-called greatness.

gurmukhi: cwry byd vKwxdw cqurmuKI hoie Krw isAwxw
transliteration: Chaaray Vayd Vakhaanadaa Chaturamoukhee Hoi Kharaa Siaanaa.
translation: He becoming four-headed and wise would recite the four Vedas.

gurmukhi: lokwN no smJwiedw dyiK sursqI rUp loBwxw
transliteration: Lokaan No Samajhaaidaa Vaykhi Surasatee Roop Lobhaanaa.
translation: He would make people understand many things but seeing the beauty of his own daughter, Sarasvati, became enamoured.

gurmukhi: cwry byd gvwie kY grbu grUrI kir pCuqwxw
transliteration: Chaaray Vayd Gavaai Kai Garabu Garooree Kari Pachhoutaanaa.
translation: He made his knowledge of the four Vedas futile. Proud as he became, he had to repent eventually.

gurmukhi: AkQ kQw nyq nyq vKwxw ]7]
transliteration: Akad Kadaa Nayt Nayt Vakhaanaa ?7?
translation: In fact the Lord is ineffable; in Vedas also He is also described as neti neti, (not this, not this).

gurmukhi: 8 ds AvqwrwN dy krq`vRX
translation: Feats of the ten incarnations

gurmukhi: ibsn ley Avqwr ds vYr ivroD joD sMGwry
transliteration: Bisan Laay Avataar Das Vair Virodh Jodh Sanghaaray.
translation: Visnu incarnated ten times and decimated his opposing warriors.

gurmukhi: mC kC vYrwh rUp hoie nrisMG bwvn bauDwry
transliteration: Machh Kachh Vairaah Roopi Hoi Narasinghu Baavan Baudhaaray.
translation: The incarnations in the forms of fish, tortoise, swine, man-lion, dwarf and Buddha etc. have happened.

gurmukhi: prsrwmu rwmu iksnu hoie klik klMkI Aiq AhMkwry
transliteration: Parasaraamu Raamu Kisanu Hoi Kilaki Kalakee Ati Ahankaaray.
translation: Parsu Ram, Ram, Kisan and very much proud incarnation of Kalki have flourished.

gurmukhi: KqRI mwir iekIh vwr rwmwiex kir BwrQ Bwry
transliteration: Khatree Maari Ikeeh Vaar Raamaain Kari Bhaarad Bhaaray.
translation: Ram was hero of Ramayan, and kisan was all in the mahabharat.

gurmukhi: kwm kroDu n swiDE loBu moh AhMkwru n mwry
transliteration: Kaam Karodhu N Saadhiao Lobhu Moh Ahankaaru N Maaray.
translation: But the lust and anger were not sublimited and greed, infatuation and ego were not eschewed.

gurmukhi: siqgur purKu n ByitAw swDsMgiq shlMg n swry
transliteration: Satigur Purakhu N Bhaytiaa Saadhasangati Sahalag N Saaray.
translation: None remembered the true Guru (God) and nobody benefited himself in the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: haumY AMdir kwir ivkwry ]8]
transliteration: Haoumai Andari Kaari Vikaaray ?8?
translation: All acted arrogantly being full of evil propensities.

gurmukhi: 9 mhwN dyv, iSv
translation: Mahadev, Siva ,

gurmukhi: mhwdyau AauDUqu hoie qwms AMdir jogu n jwxY
transliteration: Mahaadayu Audhootu Hoi Taamas Andari Jogu N Jaanai.
translation: Though Mahadev was an ascetic of high order but being full of ignorance he could not even identify yoga.

gurmukhi: BYro BUq kusUq ivc KyqRpwl bYqwl iD|wxY
transliteration: Bhairo Bhoot Kousoot Vichi Khaytrapaal Baytaal Dhiaanai.
translation: He merely subordinated Bhairav, ghosts, Ksetrapals, and baitals (all malignant spirits).

gurmukhi: Ak DqUrw Kwvxw rwqI vwsw mVHI mswxY
transliteration: Aku Dhatooraa Khaavanaa Raatee Vaasaa Marhhee Masaanai.
translation: He would eat akk ( a wild plant of sandy region – calotropis procera) and datura and lived in cemetery at night.

gurmukhi: pYnY hwQI sIh Kl faurU vwie krY hYrwxY
transliteration: Painai Haadee Seeh Khal Dauroo Vaai Karai Hairaanai.
translation: He would wear the lion or elephant skin and would make people restive by playing on damaru (tabor).

gurmukhi: nwQw nwQ sdwiedw hoie AnwQu n hir rMgu mwxY
transliteration: Naadaa Naadu Sadaaidaa Hoi Anaadu N Hari Rangu Maanai.
translation: He was known as the nath (yogi) of the naths but never becoming masterless (anath) or humble did he remember God.

gurmukhi: isriT sMGwrY qwmsI jogu n Bog n jugiq pCwxY
transliteration: Siratdi Sanghaarai Taamasee Jogu N Bhogu N Jougati Pachhaanai.
translation: His main task was to destroy world malignantly. He would not understand the technique of enjoyment and repudiation (yoga).

gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu swD sMgwxY ]9]
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Saadh Sangaanai ?9?
translation: One attains the fruits of pleasure be becoming a gurmukh a gurmukh and being in the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: 10 ieMdR qy bHmw
translation: Indr and Brahma

gurmukhi: vfI Awrjw ieMdR dI ieMdR purI ivc rwju kmwvY
transliteration: Vadee Aarajaa Indr Dee Indr Puree Vichi Raaju Kamaavai.
translation: Indr has a long age; he ruled indrpuri.

gurmukhi: caudh ieMdR ivxwsukwil bHmy dw ieku idvsu ivhwvY
transliteration: Chaudah Indr Vinaasu Kaali Brahamay Daa Iku Divasu Vihaavai.
translation: When fourteen Indrs are finished, the one day of Brahma passes I.e. in one day of Brahma fourteen Indrs rule.

gurmukhi: DMDy hI bHmw mrY loms dw ieku rom iCjwvY
transliteration: Dhandhay Hee Brahamaa Marai Lomas Daa Iku Rom Chhijaavai.
translation: With the fall of one hair of Lomas Rishi, one Brahma is known to end his life (one can very well guess that like innumerable hair Brahmas are also many).

gurmukhi: sys mhys vKwxIAin icrMjIv hoie swNiq n AwvY
transliteration: Says Mahays Vakhaaneeani Chiranjeev Hoi Saanti N Aavai.
translation: Sesanag and Mahesa are also supposed to be living eternally but none has attained peace.

gurmukhi: jog Bog jp qp Gxy lok vyd ismrxu n suhwvY
transliteration: Jog Bhog Jap Tap Ghanay Lok Vayd Simaranu N Suhaavai.
translation: God does not like the hypocrisy of yoga, hedonism, recitation, asceticism, common customary acts etc.

gurmukhi: Awpu gxwey n shij smwvY ]10]
transliteration: Aapu Ganaaay N Sahaji Samaavai ?10?
translation: He who keeps his ego with him cannot merge in equipoise.

gurmukhi: 11 nwrdwidk irKI
translation: Rishi Narad and others

gurmukhi: nwrdu munI AKwiedw Awgmu jwix n DIrju AwxY
transliteration: Naaradu Mounee Akhaaidaa Agamu Jaani N Dheeraju Aanai.
translation: Even being adept in the Vedas and Shastras Narad, the sage, had no forbearance.

gurmukhi: suix suix msliq mjlsY kir kir cuglI AwiK vKwxY
transliteration: Souni Souni Masalati Majalasai Kari Kari Chougalee Aakhi Vakhaanai.
translation: He would listen to the conversations of one assembly and would talk about it in the other.

gurmukhi: bwl buiD snkwidkw bwl suBwie nivrqI hwxY
transliteration: Baal Budhi Sanakaadikaa Baal Soubhaau Naviratee Haanai.
translation: Sanaks et al. also always reminded of the child wisdom and because of their restive nature they could never attain contentment and always suffered loss.

gurmukhi: jwie bYkuMiT kroDu kir dyie srwpu jY ibjY iD|wxY
transliteration: Jaai Baikountdi Karodhu Kari Dayi Saraapu Jaii Bijai Dhiaanai.
translation: They went to heaven and happened to curse Jay and Vijay, the door-keepers. Ultimately they had to repent.

gurmukhi: AhMmyau sukdyau kr grB vwis haumY hYrwxY
transliteration: Ahanmayu Soukadayu Kari Garabh Vaasi Haoumai Hairaanai.
translation: Because of his ego Sukadev also suffered for a long time (twelve years) in the womb of his mother.

gurmukhi: cMdu sUrju AaulMg BrY audY Asq ivic Awvx jwxY
transliteration: Chandu Sooraj Aulag Bharai Udai Asat Vichi Aavan Jaanai.
translation: Sun and moon also full of blemishes, indulge in the cycle of rising and setting.

gurmukhi: isv skqI ivic grbu gumwxY ]11]
transliteration: Siv Sakatee Vichi Garabu Goumaanai ?11?
translation: Engrossed in maya they are all afflicted by ego.

gurmukhi: 12 jqI sqI Awidk
translation: The celebates and virtuous etc.

gurmukhi: jqI sqI sMqoKIAw jq sq jugiq sMqoK n jwqI
transliteration: Jatee Satee Santokheeaa Jat Sat Jougati Santokh N Jaatee.
translation: So called celibates, virtuous and contented ones have also not understood contentment, the actual technique of celibacy and other virtues.

gurmukhi: isD nwQu bhu pMQ kir haumY ivic krin krmwqI
transliteration: Sidh Naadu Bahu Pand Kari Haoumai Vichi Karani Karamaatee.
translation: The siddhas and naths controlled by ego and divided into many sects roam hither and thither showing miraculous feats.

gurmukhi: cwir vrn sMswr ivic Kih Kih mrdy Brim BrwqI
transliteration: Chaari Varan Sansaar Vichi Khahi Khahi Maraday Bharami Bharaatee.
translation: All the four varnas in the world going astray in delusions are clashing with one another.

gurmukhi: iCA drsn hoie vriqAw bwrh vwt aucwt jmwqI
transliteration: Chhia Darasan Hoi Varatiaa Baarah Vaat Ouchaat Jamaatee.
translation: Under the aegis of the six Shastras, yogis have adopted twelve ways and becoming indifferent to the world have gone away from its responsibilities.

gurmukhi: gurmuiK vrn Avrn hoie rMg surMg qMbol suhwqI
transliteration: Guramoukhi Varan Avaran Hoi Rang Surang Tanbol Suvaatee.
translation: Gurmukh, who is beyond varnas and its further denominations, is like the betel leaf, which out of various colours adopts one steadfast colour (red) of all the virtues.

gurmukhi: iCA ruiq bwrh mwh ivic gurmuiK drsnu suJ suJwqI
transliteration: Chhia Routi Baarah Maah Vichi Guramoukhi Darasanu Sujh Sujhaatee.
translation: In the six seasons and twelve months as and when the gurmukh is visualized, he enlightens all like the sun of knowledge.

gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu iprm iprwqI ]12]
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Piram Piraatee ?12?
translation: The delightful fruit for gurmukhs is his love for the Lord.

gurmukhi: 13 DrqI qy biR`C
translation: The earth and tree

gurmukhi: pMj qq prvwxu kir Drmswl DrqI min BwxI
transliteration: Panj Tat Paravaanu Kari Dharam Saal Dhratee Mani Bhaanee.
translation: As a result of the rational combination of five elements this lovely abode of dharma in the form of earth has been created.

gurmukhi: pwxI AMdir Driq Dir DrqI AMdir DirAw pwxI
transliteration: Paanee Andari Dharati Dhari Dharatee Andari Dhariaa Paanee.
translation: The earth is placed in water and again in earth, water is placed.

gurmukhi: isr qlvwey ruK hoie inhclu icq invwsu ibbwxI
transliteration: Sir Talavaaay Roukh Hoi Nihachalu Chit Nivaasu Bibaanee.
translation: Having their heads downward i.e. the trees rooted in earth grow on it and reside in the deep lone forests.

gurmukhi: praupkwrI suPl Pil vt vgwie isriT vruswxI
transliteration: Paraoupakaaree Suphal Phali Vat Vagaai Siratdi Varasaanee.
translation: These trees are also altruists which when stoned rain fruits for the creatures on earth.

gurmukhi: cMdn vwsu vxwspq cMdnu hoie vwsu mihkwxI
transliteration: Chandan Vaasu Vanaasapati Chandanu Hoi Vaasu Mahikaanee.
translation: The fragrance of sandal makes the whole vegetation fragrant.

gurmukhi: sbd suriq ilv swDsMig gurmuiK suKPl AMmiRqvwxI
transliteration: Sabad Surati Liv Saadhasangi Guramoukhi Soukh Phal Anmrit Vaanee.
translation: In the holy company of Gurmukhs the consciousness is merged into Word and man attains the fruits of delight through the ambrosial speech.

gurmukhi: Aibgiq giq Aiq AkQ khwxI ]13]
transliteration: Abigati Gati Ati Akad Kahaanee ?13?
translation: Ineffable is the story of the unmanifest Lord; His dynamism is unknowable.

gurmukhi: 14 DÍwid skwm Bgq
translation: The devotes live Dhruv et al.

gurmukhi: DRU piHlwdu BBIKxo AMbrIku bil jnk vKwxw
transliteration: Dhr Prahilaadu Bhabheekhano Anbareeku Bali Janaku Vakhaanaa.
translation: Dhru, Prahlad, Vibhisan, Ambris, Bali, Janak are well known personalities.

gurmukhi: rwj kuAwr hoie rwjsI Awsw bMDI coj ivfwxw
transliteration: Raaj Kuaar Hoi Raajasee Aasaa Bandhee Choj Vidaanaa.
translation: They all were princes, and hence the rajas game of hope and desire was always on them.

gurmukhi: DRU mqryeI cMifAw pIau PiV piHlwdu r\\\\wxw
transliteration: Dhr Matarayee Chandiaa Peeu Dharhi Prahilaadu Raanaa.
translation: Dhru was beaten up by his stepmother and Prahlad was caused to suffer by his father.

gurmukhi: Byd BBIKxu lMk lY AMbrIku lY ckR luBwxw
transliteration: Bhaydu Bhabheekhanu Lak Lai Anbareeku Lai Chakr Loubhaanaa.
translation: Vibhisan got Lanka by divulging the secrets of home and Ambris became happy seeing the Sudarsan chakr, as his protector (to save Ambris from the curse of Durvasa, Visnu had sent his chakr).

gurmukhi: pYru kVwhY jnk dw kir pwKMf Drm iD|wxw
transliteration: Pair Karhaa Hai Janak Daa Kari Paakhandu Dharam Dhitaanaa.
translation: Janak by keeping one leg into the soft bedding and another into the boiling cauldron showed his power of hathayoga and let down the real dharma.

gurmukhi: Awpu gxwie ivgucxw drgh pwey mwxu inmwxw
transliteration: Aapu Gavaai Vigouchanaa Daragah Paaay Maanu Nimaanaa.
translation: The man who has eschewed his ego and has subsumed in the Lord is respected in the court of Lord.

gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu piq prvwxw ]14]
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Pati Paravaanaa ?14?
translation: Only Gurmukhs have attained the fruits of delight and only they are accepted (here and hereafter).

gurmukhi: 15 nIc kul inSkwmu Bgq
translation: Low born selfless devotees

gurmukhi: kljug nwmw Bgqu hoie Pyir dyhurw gwie ijvweI
transliteration: Kalajougi Naamaa Bhagatu Hoi Dhayri Dayhuraa Gaai Jivaaee.
translation: In kaliyuga, a devotee named Namdev made the temple rotate and dead cow alive.

gurmukhi: Bgqu kbIr vKwxIAY bMdI Kwny qy auiT jweI
transliteration: Bhagatu Kabeeru Vakhaaneeai Bandee Khaanay Tay Outdi Jaaee.
translation: It is said Kabir used to go out of prison as and when he liked.

gurmukhi: DMnw jtu auDwirAw sDnw jwiq Ajwiq ksweI
transliteration: Dhannaa Jatu Udhaariaa Sadhanaa Jaati Ajaati Kasaaee.
translation: Dhanna, the jatt (farmer) and Sadhana born in a known low cast butcher got across the world ocean.

gurmukhi: jnu rivdwsu cmwru hoie chu vrnwN ivic kir vifAweI
transliteration: Janu Ravidaasu Chamaaru Hoi Chahu Varanaa Vichi Kari Vadiaaee.
translation: Considering Ravi Das a devotee of the Lord, all the four varnas praise him.

gurmukhi: byix hoAw AiDAwqmI sYxu nIc kulu AMdir nweI
transliteration: Bayni Hoaa Adhiaatamee Sainu Neechu Kulu Andari Naaee.
translation: Beni, the saint was a spiritualist, and born in a so-called low barber caste Sain was a devotee (of Lord).

gurmukhi: pYrI pY pwKwk hoie gurisKwN ivic vfI smweI
transliteration: Pairee Pai Paa Khaak Hoi Gurasikhaan Vichi Vadee Samaaee.
translation: Falling at and becoming the dust of the feet is the great trance for the Sikhs of the Guru (their caste should not be considered).

gurmukhi: AlK lKwie n AlKu lKweI ]15]
transliteration: Alakhu Lakhaai N Alakhu Lakhaaee ?15?
translation: The devotees, though they behold the imperceptible Lord, yet do not disclose this to anyone.

gurmukhi: 16 kljug dI au`qmqweI
translation: Superiority of the kaliyuga, in the dark age

gurmukhi: siqjugu auqmu AwKIAY ieku PyVY sB dysu duhylw
transliteration: Satijougu Outamu Aakheeai Iku Dhayrhai Sabh Daysu Duhaylaa.
translation: Satyuga is said to be best but in it one committed sin and the whole country suffered.

gurmukhi: qRyqY ngrI pIVIAY duAwpuir vMsu ivDuMsu kuvylw
transliteration: Traytai Nagaree Peerheeai Duaapuri Vansu Vidhounsu Kuvaylaa.
translation: In treta, one did the wrong act and the whole city would suffer.  In Duapar, sinful act of one person made the whole family suffer.

gurmukhi: kiljuig scu inAwau hY jo bIjY so luxY iekylw
transliteration: Kalijougi Sachu Niaau Hai Jo Beejai So Lounai Ikaylaa.
translation: The justice of Kaliyuga is true because in it only he reaps who sows the evil seeds.

gurmukhi: pwrbHm pUrn bHm sbid suriq siqgur gur cylw
transliteration: Paarabrahamu Pooranu Brahamu Sabadi Surati Satiguroo Gur Chaylaa.
translation: Brahm is the perfect Sabdabrahm and that disciple who merges his consciousness in the Sabdabrahm is in fact Guru and the true Guru (God).

gurmukhi: nwm dwnu iesnwnu diRV swDsMgiq imil AMmiRq vylw
transliteration: Naamu Daanu Isanaanu Drirh Saadhasangati Mili Anmrit Vaylaa.
translation: Sabdabrahm, the Guru is attained in the holy congregation by remembering the name of the Lord in the ambrosial hours.

gurmukhi: imTw bolxu inv clxu hQhu dyxw shj suhylw
transliteration: Mitdaa Bolanu Niv Chalanu Hadahu Daynaa Sahij Suhaylaa.
translation: A mild spoken, humble and giver through his hands moves in equipoise and remains happy.

gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu nyhu nvylw ]16]
transliteration: Guramoukh Soukh Phal Nayhu Navaylaa ?16?
translation: Ever new love of devotion to the Lord keeps the gurmukhs happy.

gurmukhi: 17 vwihgurU mMqR
translation: Waheguru mantara

gurmukhi: inrMkwr Awkwru kir joiq srUp AnUp idKwieAw
transliteration: Nirankaaru Aakaaru Kari Joti Saroopu Anoop Dikhaaiaa.
translation: The formless Lord has been beholden in the form of the light (in Guru Nanak and other Gurus).

gurmukhi: byd kqyb Agocrw vwihgurU gur sbdu suxwieAw
transliteration: Vayd Katayb Agocharaa Vaahiguroo Gur Sabadu Sounaaiaa.
translation: The Gurus recited Word-Guru as Vahiguru who is beyond the Vedas and Katebas (the semtic scriptures).

gurmukhi: cwir vrn cwr mjhbw crx kvl srxwgiq AwieAw
transliteration: Chaari Varan Chaari Majahabaa Charan Kaval Saranaagati Aaiaa.
translation: Therefore all the four varnas and all four semitic religions have sought the shelter of the lotus feet of the Guru.

gurmukhi: pwrs pris Aprs jig AstDwqu ieku Dwqu krwieAw
transliteration: Paarasi Parasi Aparas Jagi Asat Dhaatu Iku Dhaatu Karaaiaa.
translation: When the Gurus in the form of Philosopher’s stone touched them, that alloy of eight metal changed into one metal (gold in the form of Sikhism).

gurmukhi: pYrI pwie invwiekY haumY rogu AswDu imtwieAw
transliteration: Pairee Paai Nivaaikai Haoumai Rogu Asaadhu Mitaaiaa.
translation: The Gurus giving them place at their feet removed their incurable malady of ego.

gurmukhi: hukim rjweI clxw gurmuiK gwfI rwhu clwieAw
transliteration: Houkami Rajaaee Chalanaa Guramoukhi Gaadee Raahu Chalaaiaa.
translation: For Gurmukhs they cleared the highway of God’s will.

gurmukhi: pUry pUrw Qwtu bxwieAw ]17]
transliteration: Pooray Pooraa Daatu Banaaiaa ?17?
translation: The perfect (Guru) made the perfect arrangements.

gurmukhi: 18 gurmuK vrnx
translation: Gurmukh

gurmukhi: jMmx mrxhu bwhry praupkwrI jg ivic Awey
transliteration: Janmanu Maranahu Baaharay Paraoupakaaree Jag Vichi Aaay.
translation: Being beyond transmigration the altruists came in this world.

gurmukhi: Bwau Bgiq aupdys kir swDsMgiq scKMf vswey
transliteration: Bhaau Bhagati Oupadaysu Kari Saadh Sangati Sachakhandi Vasaaay.
translation: Preaching loving devotion, they, through the holy congregation reside in the abode of truth.

gurmukhi: mwn srovir prmhMs gurmuiK sbd suriq ilv lwey
transliteration: Maan Sarovari Paramahans Guramoukhi Sabad Surati Liv Laaay.
translation: Gurmukhs being swans of highest order (paramhains) keep their consciousness merged in Word, the Brahm.

gurmukhi: cMdn vws vxwspiq APl sPl cMdn mihkwey
transliteration: Chandan Vaasu Vanaasapati Aphal Saphal Chandan Mahakaaay.
translation: They are like sandal, which makes the fruitful and fruitless vegetation fragrant.

gurmukhi: Bvjl AMdir bohQY hoie prvwr su pwr lMGwey
transliteration: Bhavajal Andari Bohadai Hoi Paravaar Sadhaar Laghaaay.
translation: Into the world ocean they are like that vessel which takes the whole family across comfortably.

gurmukhi: lhir qrMgu n ivAwpeI mwieAw ivic audwsu rhwey
transliteration: Lahari Tarangu N Viaapaee Maaiaa Vichi Udaasu Rahaaay.
translation: They remain undistributed and detached amid the waves of worldly phenomena.

gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu sihj smwey ]18]
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Sahaji Samaaay ?18?
translation: Remaining absorbed in the equipoise is the delightful fruit if the gurmukhs.

gurmukhi: 19 Ajr jrxw
translation: To bear the unbearable

gurmukhi: DMnu gurU gur isK DMnu Awid purKu Awdysu krwieAw
transliteration: Dhannu Guroo Gur Sikhu Dhannu Aadi Purakhu Aadaysu Karaaiaa.
translation: The blest is disciple as well as the Guru who has made the disciple to pray before the primeval Lord.

gurmukhi: siqgur drsn DMnu hY DMn idsit gur iDAwnu DrwieAw
transliteration: Satigur Darasanu Dhannu Hai Dhann Disati Gur Dhiaanu Dharaaiaa.
translation: Blessed is the glimpse of the true Guru and that vision is also blessed one which peeps the mind concentrated upon the Guru.

gurmukhi: DMnu DMnu siqgur sbdu DMnu suriq gur igAwnu suxwieAw
transliteration: Dhannu Dhannu Satigur Sabadu Dhannu Surati Gur Giaanu Sounaaiaa.
translation: The Word of the true Guru and that meditational faculty is also blessed which has made the mind sustain the true knowledge bestowed by Guru.

gurmukhi: crx kvl gur DMnu DMnu DMnu msqku gur crxI lwieAw
transliteration: Charan Kaval Gur Dhannu Dhannu Dhannu Masataku Gur Charanee Laaiaa.
translation: Blessed are the lotus feet of the Guru along with that forehead which rests upon the feet of the Guru.

gurmukhi: DMnu DMnu gur aupdysu hY DMnu irdw gurmMqR vswieAw
transliteration: Dhannu Dhannu Gur Oupadaysu Hai Dhannu Ridaa Guramantr Vasaaiaa.
translation: Auspicious is the teaching of the Guru and that heart is a blessed one wherein resides the Guru manta.

gurmukhi: DMnu DMnu guru crxwmqo DMnu muhqu ijqu AipE pIAwieAw
transliteration: Dhannu Dhannu Guru Charanaamato Dhannu Mahatu Jitu Apiao Peeaaiaa.
translation: Auspicious is the wash of Guru’s feet’s and that wisdom is also blessed one which understanding its importance has tasted that rare nectar.

gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu Ajru jrwieAw ]19]
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukhu Phalu Ajaru Jaraaiaa ?19?
translation: This way, the gurmukhs have endured the unsustainable delight of the fruit of Guru’s Glimpse.

gurmukhi: 20 swD sMg mihmw
translation: Grandeur of the holy congregation

gurmukhi: suK swgru hY swDsMgu soBw lihr qrMg Aqoly
transliteration: Soukh Saagaru Hai Saadhasangu Sobhaa Lahari Tarang Atolay.
translation: Holy congregation is that ocean of delight in which the waves of Lord’s praise adorn it.

gurmukhi: mwxk moqI hIirAw gur aupdysu Avysu Amoly
transliteration: Maanak Motee Heeriaa Gur Oupadaysu Avaysu Amolay.
translation: Myriad rubies diamonds and pearls in the form of Guru’s teachings exist in this ocean.

gurmukhi: rwg rqn Anhd DunI sbid suriq ilv Agm Aloly
transliteration: Raag Ratan Anahad Dhounee Sabadi Surati Liv Agam Alolay.
translation: Musicality here is like a jewel and merging their consciousness in the rhythm of the unstruck Word, the listeners listen to it with rapt attention.

gurmukhi: iriD isiD iniD sB golIAwN cwir pdwrQ goiel goly
transliteration: Ridhi Sidhi Nidhi Sabh Goleeaan Chaari Padaarad Goil Golay.
translation: Here the miraculous powers are subservient and the four ideals of life (dharm, arth, kam and moks) are servants and being transitory does not attract the attention of the people who reached this stage.

gurmukhi: lK lK cMd crwgcI lK lK AMmiRq pIcin Joly
transliteration: Lakh Lakh Chand Charaagachee Lakh Lakh Anmrit Peechani Jholay.
translation: Myriad means here work as lamps and myriad men getting elated quaff the nectar.

gurmukhi: kwmDynu lK pwrjwq jMgl AMdir crin Afoly
transliteration: Kaamadhaynu Lakh Paarijaat Jangal Andari Charani Adolay.
translation: Myriad of wish fulfilling cows gaze delightfully in the forest of wish fulfilling trees.

gurmukhi: gurmuK suK Plu bol Aboly ]20]12]
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Bol Abolay ?20?12?baaraan?
translation: In fact the pleasure fruit of the gurmukhs is ineffable.

gurmukhi: jau lau Anrs bis qau lau nhI pRym rsu jau lau Awn iDAwn Awpw Awpu nhI dyKIAY
transliteration: Jau Lau Anaras Basi Tau Lau Nahee Praym Rasu , Jau Lau Aan Dhiaan Aapaa Aapu Nahee Daykheeai ?
translation: So long a human being remains absorbed in worldly attractions and pleasures, he cannot know love. So long his attention is focused on something else, he cannot realize self.

gurmukhi: jau lau Awn igAwn qau lau nhI AiDAwqm igAwn jau lau nwd bwd n Anwhd ibsyKIAY
transliteration: Jau Lau Aan Giaan Tau Lau Nahee Adhiaatam Giaana , Jau Lau Naad Baad N Anaahad Bisaykheeai ?
translation: (Renouncing Lord) as long as one is busy acquiring knowledge of mundane worldly things, he remains bereft of spiritual wisdom. As long as one remains involved in worldly pleasures one cannot hear the unstruck celestial music of divine word.

gurmukhi: jau lau AhMbuiD suiD hoie n AMqir giq jau lau n lKwvY qau lau AlK n lyKIAY
transliteration: Jau Lau Ahanbudhi Sudhi Hoi N Antari Gati , Jau Lau N Lakhaavai Tau Lau Alakh N Laykheeai ?
translation: As long as one remains proud and arrogant, one cannot realise self. Till such time True Guru does not initiate a person with the boon of Lord's name and propitiate the Lord, one cannot realise the 'formless God'.

gurmukhi: siq rUp siqnwm siqgur igAwn iDAwn eyk hI Anyk myk eyk eyk ByKIAY ]12]
transliteration: Sati Roop Satinaam Satigur Giaan Dhiaana , Ayk Hee Anayk Mayk Ayk Ayk Bhaykheeai ?12?
translation: The knowledge of Almighty lies in the consecrating words of the True Guru that leads one to reality of His name and form. By uniting his mind with His name, the Lord who prevails in various forms gets revealed. (12)
